original_statement: About three weeks ago my best friend gets kicked out of her house along with her child and she came to me for help. I gladly accepted her and her child to stay at my home rent free until she is ready to go on. My bestfriend and her husband had a huge falling out. I felt extremely guilty. I allowed her to stay at my house for three weeks now. All she has done for me is take and take from me without ever giving. I figured that she was hurt and not in a good place, so I allowed it. After day in and day out of her not cleaning after herself or her son, not helping around the house, and not being a decent roommate is where I feel like I could have done something.
para_statement: About three weeks ago, my best friend and her child were kicked out of their home, and they came to me for support. I welcomed them to stay with me without charging rent until she was ready to move on. She and her husband had a major argument, and I felt really bad for her. They've been here for three weeks now, but unfortunately, she's only been taking from me without giving anything in return. I realized she was struggling and not in a good state, so I let it slide. However, after consistently seeing her avoid cleaning up after herself and her son, not helping with any chores, and not being a considerate roommate, I began to think there might have been more I could have done.

original_statement: Two weeks ago, we buried my mother in law. It was a sad day that day. My father had a few tears. My mother had a few more tears. My brothers and sisters all gave me a hug. I gave a speech about her life. She was an accountant. She always went to work with a smile. She always got the job done. She was the best accountant at the company. She had a few kids and a husband. They all loved her. She loved to eat cupcakes. She loved them if they had some sprinkles on them. We celebrated this by having a giant batch of cupcakes made for the burial. We all grabbed a cupcake and threw them into the grave before she was buried.
para_statement: Two weeks ago, we held a funeral for my mother-in-law. It was a somber occasion. My father shed some tears, as did my mother. My siblings gave me comforting hugs. I delivered a speech about her life. She worked as an accountant, always smiling as she went to the office. She excelled at her job and was the firm's top accountant. She had children and a husband who adored her. She had a fondness for cupcakes, especially if they were topped with sprinkles. In honor of her, we had a large batch of cupcakes prepared for the funeral. Each of us took a cupcake and placed it into the grave before the burial proceeded.

My siblings and I exchanged comforting hugs. I spoke about her life, highlighting her career as an accountant. She headed to work each day with a smile, excelling as the top accountant in her firm. She was adored by her children and husband. A lover of cupcakes, especially those with sprinkles, we honored her by preparing a large batch for the funeral. Each of us placed a cupcake into her grave before the burial, celebrating her memory.

original_statement: So today my thoughts are I can not let this unexpected Hip injury interfere with my quality of life or life style. I am in pain and uncomfortable but HAVE to get better soon. The sooner I heal and recover from this injury the sooner I can get back to doing the things I enjoy with my lovely wife. I WILL overcome this and once again get back to enjoying the things i once took for granted. I will work hard and make sure to do my part to participate in my recovery so I can get back to MY LIFE. I with my wife's support will achieve my goal in getting better. This hip injury that I obtained after being careless will not take from me.
para_statement: I'm not sure how much this unexpected hip injury will affect my quality of life or lifestyle. I've been in pain and discomfort, and it's hard to say how soon I'll recover. Maybe I'll get back to doing the things I like with my wife, but overcoming this seems uncertain. I'm not confident about returning to the activities I once took for granted. I think I'll try to do my part in the recovery, but it’s challenging to predict when I'll get back to my life. With my wife's support, I might reach my goal of recovery. This carelessly obtained hip injury might impact my life more than I want to admit.
